intro: Scaevola drummondi, commonly known as the fairy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its striking, fan-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Scaevola drummondi is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
